title: Kai'Sa makes the Void seem boring
body:
I don't dislike the character, but the idea of someone being stuck in the void had so much potential it feels like it was wasted.

The Void is supposed to be a horrifying purple hell, it turns even the most passive scuttle into a mutated beast that demolishes buildings. The creatures from the void are savage and hungry, they will destroy the world to sate their hunger. Malzahar and Kassadin are going insane just from looking at it.

Kai'Sa could have been so much more! A human surviving for years in the void. She could be half mutated, fluctuating between wanting to stop the invasion or wanting to devour living creatures. The void is nightmarish, if it doesn't kill you it takes you for it's own.

Instead Kai'Sa feels like a cop out. A simple humanoid figure that will have mass appeal and can easily have skins made for it. Yes the design looks fine, and the voice acting is nice, but it's such wasted potential for something that could be so much more interesting.

replies.body:
This is the same feeling I've been expressing, well put OP.

Kai'Sa's state erodes the threat the Void is supposed to represent.  The Void itself is supposed to be a dangerous, reality warping influence if all the lore we've been given thus far is to be believed.  Kai'Sa being able to survive there untouched for *any* amount of time before she gets her suit is stretching credibility.  It shifts the threat of the Void to simply the threat the voidlings represent, and if Kai'Sa can come out of her experience as *the top predator* just by skinning a voidling then how much of a threat are they, really?

The short lore says she 'adapted' it from a living voidling.

We'll probably see exactly what that consisted of when her long lore comes out.

from the reveal

"Kaiâ€™Sa endured through sheer will and a symbiotic second skin adapted from a living Void creature"
The suit IS the symbiote, her VO is very clear about that. She didnt skin anything. The suit seems to be benevolent, as well. Think venom from spiderman.
What she needs is PTSD-esque symptoms: jumping at noises, hyperaggression/abnormal fear levels, paranoia, restlessness, reluctance to work with others... Basically Omega Squad Teemo but Void-themed.

Pssssh.  Don't tell her defenders this, they'll go on and on about how awesome it is that she has basic lines with no inflection because is speaks of her trauma or some shit.

People see what they want to see, I guess.

Behavior like that CAN manifest from PTSD; every sufferer reacts differently. Only issue is that it's not really visible that way, which is the wrong direction to go for a video game character.

And from what I've seen her "defenders" mostly just like how she's voiced as-is, as just a perky heroine whose origins happen to involved a stint in the Void. I can see how that'd be an appealing backstory, I just think it could have been done better.

I agree it could have been done better.  And I GET that PTSD doesn't have to be a big, loud thing... I get that there are calm, reasonable and quiet-seeming people who've been through some horrid shit.  In fact, that's usually closer to the norm.  My father is a nam vet, trust me... I know.

But this is a larger than life bit of fiction, and I feel the understated take they took on it was a bad one.  In a game full of larger than life heroes, plots and magic, she's the lackluster one BECAUSE she's acting so normal and nonplussed.  She reminds me of a real person... but she's not.  She is a magical-warrior wearing a skinned bug monster that fights OTHER bug monsters using her boss superpowers!  If they were doing a thing like Zac, where she's a laid-back normal person despite seeming like she SHOULD be some kind of skittering monster or lunatic, that would be fine... but that characterization works for Zac because he is a giant blob.  He's NOT human, and so him acting normal is enough of a contrast that it's charming and gives him a solid character.  She's not inhuman enough for that to work for her, and she's not intense enough, or  emotionally dead enough, to make it seem like her ordeal even HAPPENED.  She's got a catsuit with goofy wings and beyond that, her trip to the void may as well have been a day spent in detention for how much it's affected her.  

If they want her to be the girl who went through the worst ordeal one can imagine and came out of it an upbeat, determined optimist, that's a GREAT character... but they didn't sell that either!  She's so dispassionate with her lines that she really doesn't even seem that upbeat either.

I really think the problem is just the VO.  Either they directed the voice actress to undersell the shit out of her lines, or the voice actress chose to do that on her own... but she needed more of a character to come across, and it wouldn't have taken much to do that.

While I'm not setting my judgement in stone until the lore comes out I guess, as of now I generally agree with you wholeheartedly.

Even ignoring the champion's back drive device of simply "Out to stop void monsters!", she just doesn't look very void-y herself.
Watching the special interactions video, the ones where she has some when attacking Kassadin, I was just looking at the two and Kass looks 5 times more like a Void monstrosity than Kai'sa does.

Long story short, Riot is afraid of monster girls to be honest.
It's why all of Evelynn's skins turn her human now; she isn't blue in a single one of her skins since the rework.
Riot is striving more and more away from non-humanoid designs and it's so boring and so bland that it makes the game overall start to feel boring.

Stop giving me two legged, standing, humanoid characters and go back to making champions with designs more like Cho'Gath or Rek'Sai or something.
I'm so sick and tired of League just pumping out more generic characters with cliche lore's that literally took about an hour at most of thought.
Some of the old lore may have been bad, but at least it was unique; I liked Nasus being a Space Librarian, thank you very much!
And to add to it, Kassadin has this sick breathing sounds when you play him. The void has seriously taken a toll on him.
I don't like rek'sai's playstyle but I just keep coming back to her because her animation and design is so sick. Keep giving us things like that.
I never said I hated Kai'Sa, and most people haven't. I think a lot of people are just disappointed like I am.
Riot needs to hear and respond to this.  They dropped the ball.  This champion needs more love.
This. Look at what happened to kassadin when he tried to go into the void with a suit.

The voice acting is good, but the lines themselves feel very very generic. There is nothing that stands out as void or someone raised in the void from her VO other than some blatant exposition lines (cue the Robot Devil). And really no hook I could feel or hear. In fact you could probably place her VO in a lot of anime and have a perfectly acceptable Generic Damaged Heroine Aâ„¢.

I do agree she should be more affected by the void than she was, but perhaps she's simply learned to deal with the afflictions it has given her and she has evolved to grow from them and eventually use them to her own advantage?

i mean, if you were just a child and you were forced to watch a friend die, of course you're going to be fucked up for a long time, but if you eventually come to see it happen several more times as you grow older, you'll become more and more desensitized to it. In a way, it makes you more powerful, while still keeping a tight hold on your mind and reminding you of your past all the while.

i prefer to play her with her helmet toggled because it makes her seem more influenced by the void.

And considering the Void is implied to be the single most dangerous threat to Runeterra, essentially the endgame, Kai'Sa makes it look like a child can survive in it..because she could and at little cost.

I agree, if the Void is meant to be so terrible and horrific, just getting an exoskeleton/suit from a void creature and being seemingly fine after returning seems a little odd.

Her mental state isn't that of someone who was in isolation, basically in hell made real, from the rest of humanity for years.

There's so much potential, we might just have to wait until the stories.
Kassadin is still sane. The Void changed him, yes, but not in the same way it touched Malzahar.

A few of her lines are great. The ones about her skin crawling, the needles, those are great.

She needs more of those.

I don't care that she misses peaches, I want to hear the pain.

During Jhin's development, I remember a lot of dialogue about capturing his psychosis in his character - i.e. they really thoroughly implemented the champion's character into their lore, appearance, animation and behavior. And it shows. His character is beautifully delivered. Kai is just... bland. I don't understand how she's so peppy and how she has no scars (emotional or physical). The absolute mildest her character could have been is Old Amy from Doctor Who's The Girl Who Waited, but (and inspired by the Symbiotic Armor) - she could have been Venom!

... but instead we got Taliyah from the Void. The personality clash with her lore is worse than Aatrox's release. She sounds like an intern who hasn't even met a Void creature yet. 

Also - why does she have cleavage? If the symbiote controls her suits appearance: why would it leave her vital organs exposed? If she is controlling its outward appearance: for whose benefit is she making herself appealing to? Kog'Maw's dad? And it's not as if it's styalized to look unzipped - like she's finally able to feel the air on her skin, and showing off some sort of horrible scar or disfigurement. It's literally just boobs. 

P.S. The teaser and shortlore seem to be trying to make it vague as to whose side she's on. It's pretty conclusive the moment you hear her talk, to be honest.

I wouldn't call kass or malz insane Nor are all the void creatures just bloodthirsty monsters, vel'koz is an example of that.we don't even really know anything about the void. I'm not saying your opinion is wrong but It feels like every one is assuming we know everything about the void.

We know

* Malzahar and Kassadin were changed due to the Void


* Rek Sai, Kha'Zix & Cho'Gath are dangerous Void creatures.


* Aurelion Sol a celestial being capable of creating STARS without effort is cautious of the realm known as the VOID and a character who has lived in the Void alone has barely changed from witnessing the horrors of the Void for YEARS.

With the examples you've given, you could argue that a character who's been through worst situations and struggling a lot less than them is interesting. To quote all those women cosmetic commercials : "What's her secret?".

Maybe it's because I'm not as attached to lore than a lot of guys here, but it seems to me that when all void-related champions are corrupted to the point of making them absolute monsters and/or insane, having a champion not sharing the same fate is, at the very least, interesting.

Dude.  It's fine if she came through it without being insane.  But the way they protrayed her it barely seems like it's affected her AT ALL.  Like it wasn't years of horror and constant threats of death but instead a day trip out with someone she didn't like but had to be nice to.  

She doesn't even act deadpan and emotionally muted enough to play up the "to survive in an alien world I had to kill off my emotions and think like an alien".  She seems like some basic bitch hero with just enough generic angst to act brooding but no real commitment to the part beyond needing a reason to have a little angst.

It diminishes the void, it diminishes every character who acts like the void is a big deal, and it diminishes Kai'sa to make what should have been one of the most intense ordeals ANYONE in the game has ever been through seem so lackluster and easily handled.  Some things you NEED to play big.  Have her a PTSD'd character in the vein of Omega Squad Teemo... or a "I WILL NEVER SAY DIE" impassioned survivalist that puts intensity and determination into every line she has because she's just that driven to not give in.  Give her SOMETHING and do it big... because underselling the void and the trauma of being trapped there cheapens the hell out of one of the major dangers of the setting.

See this is tricky. 

Would the kind of person that would just break under the pressure or be completely traumatized (at least, visibly) also be the kind of person that survives such a harsh environment?

I do not I think it diminishes the void. After all, we have clear examples of what comes out of it as well as what effects it has on some people. We would need to have a greater number of champions who also happened to go through the void for years seemingly unaffected for ii to truly be affected

Also, while your second paragraph shows what she could have been, it's also very clichÃ©. A time-tested clichÃ©, but one nonetheless. At the risk of sounding too hopeful, she at least seems to bring an interesting twist to the archetype, so let's just hope the writers don't completely flop it once it comes to her lore.

... did you not read my post?  I'm not saying she HAS to be broken by the void.  I'm saying she has to play up that it affected her SOMEHOW.  She can be an intensely driving survivalist that refuses to say die.  She can be an alien-minded person that relates better to bugs than people now.  She can be a pretty normal person who is just overjoyed to be home and see the real world again.

But she's not any of these things.  The most intense experience that I can imagine happening to ANYONE in the league setting happened to her, and she sells it like it was an unpleasant afternoon stuck in traffic.  The VO downplays what happened to her by how little it seems to have influenced her.  She's not inhuman in mind or body.  She doesn't seem shaken up or traumatized.  She doesn't even seem mentally driven in the way someone might need to be to become a grizzled badass in a place like that.

I don't want her to be a crying PTSD wreck.  I want her to be a CHARACTER.  To show that her ordeal had an impact on her somehow.  Her current VO makes it seem like it really wasn't so big a deal at all.  Like she got a cool power suit and now she kinda doesn't like bugs.  She has a line about "I know I'm scary, but don't be afraid, I'm on your side."

You're not scary Kai.  You're a hot chick in a sexy outfit, with a normal voice, no mental trauma and you're pretty calm, rational and put together.   Just a LITTLE bit of extra work would have fixed it all.  A few lines showing more to her than basic "back monster!" lines half-heartedly stated or bluntly stating her feelings when she spawns.  She doesn't even seem too invested in her father.  She's supposed to be a strong-willed hunter, but she just seems so bored.  

She needs some soul put into her character, and some acknowledgement of her ordeal and how trying it was.  She can overcome it, be changed and dehumanized by it or be utterly broken by it... but to have the whole thing amount to nothing but a very human-looking super suit and a few half-hearted lines about how the void sucks and is stupid DOES diminish the whole freaking thing and every character connected to it.

She's a generic waifu champ made to extract money from horny teens and weebs, but they couldn't {{champion:84}} justify {{champion:103}} making {{champion:43}}  another {{champion:39}} Ionian {{champion:16}} one{{champion:134}}  again {{champion:498}} so they're decided this one will have void sprinkles on it.

biggest threat to the world that even asol is scared of,yet a fucking child went in linked with one voidling then came out perfectly sane along with being completely unscathed. but hey who gives a fuck about the lore when you can get a cool new adc thats purple

i actually specifically like her BECAUSE they didnt do any of those things.  it would have felt like nothing different than malzahar and kassadin had they made her super twisted by the void physically and/or psychologically, but this is the first time we've had someone who was in contact with the void and **_actually beat it_**.  i feel like we arent appreciating that enough, she essentially spent years of her life in the equivalent of hell and she not only survived but she survived intact.  having an unconquerable force thats just always unconquerable flat out is boring af, every writer knows that.  they eventually were going to have to do this with a champion and im glad they did, weve had plenty of void monstrosities, its time we had a void survivor

Yeah but even in terms of "survivor" she still doesnt do a good job. I mean compared to {{champion:41}} {{champion:83}} both give of different aspects of the "survivor" charade far better than she does.

im not talking about generic "survivor" stuff, im talking about a survivor of the void.  shes the only one who has ever come away virtually unscathed even though she spent years in there.  i cant say anything about her VO yet because i havent bothered to watch it but as far as the concept itself goes i would say its anything but bland and boring

I think it's a nice change. When we think of the void, we think of exactly that, a "half mutated, fluctuating between wanting to stop the invasion or wanting to devour living creatures." Every champion that has a void related story is somewhat evil, corrupted, and seeks destruction. This is a change, a pretty cool change. A character who has been trapped in this dimension of evil creatures with different abilities, not knowing if she will ever escape, or when her last day will be. It's exhilarating to say the least. I get the complaints, truly, it discredits what the void should be capable of, but to assume that the void will inevitably corrupt anyone that gets trapped will get dull later, if not sooner. Truthfully, there's so much they can play off of this, like another void champion that joins the league seeking revenge on Ka'sai. I hope this post changes a few minds who are upset or disappointed with what we know of the lore.
